Articles.Content:
Creepy pasta and fake things aren't welcome here

I think every game,even such a beautiful masterpiece like KSP has something creepy in it.

Duna always scared me.Even now,when I have a flag there,I sent a probe "rover/plane" to fly around,find face,curiosity,sstv...

But I discovered a creepy thing just a day before.When I was landing (ok ok,SPINNING) down to the surface,I saw a creepy thing.It was like a column of white smoke or steam.Size was like 2 kerbals stacked on each other. You may say that was bugged smoke from engine? Nope,I was "landing" with an ion engine so It couldn't be any smoke. I thing it was a "human" from sstv signal.

Sorry for no pictures,I was really scared so clicked f9 immediately D:

If anyone's interested in my rover,here it is: http://i.imgur.com/6hzSg4t.png

And lines on Eeloo...do they mean something? Ike looks creepy too...

If you found something creepy (bugs don't count), post it here please.

and if you're quoting comments with pictures,delete picture and use -snip- instead ^^

Edited October 6, 2013 by JiWint
oh,what the....? Are bugs addicted to me?

There are legends of the ghosts of Duna. Sometimes strange glows come from the surface, to lure unfortunate Kerbals to their demise

(Seriously, at first I thought it was a graphics glitch and the sun was just shining through the planet but the angles are wrong, the sun is further left in this image)

Munar South pole. A large hole. It scared me as I tried to fly in it.

Edited October 5, 2013 by Monkeh

That one was more cute than scary haha

Especially with the empty seat in view

Dizzle xD

Glows on duna? wait,I have a photo of a "sparkle"

can you see 3 little sparkles? wth?

JiWint, Solyaris is not a fringe movie, and the sparkles are normal bugs that happen more often at low graphic settings.

This is creepy.

Has it been long enough to mention this again? I think the creepiest thing bar none is how 2 of the seats inside the Hitchhiker have signs over them saying "Food" and "Not Food". Obviously I added text and the down-pointing arrows, but I only did so because the words above the seats immediately suggested this to me.

I've been told that my old Ouroboros station is kind of creepy.

You tell me.

[deleted]

Edited March 21, 2023 by generalguy26
Here's Johnny!!!
Reminds me of Apollo 18 when the missing astronaut comes back and is trying to break the glass on the capsule and then gets got by a huge spider thing.

Has it been long enough to mention this again? I think the creepiest thing bar none is how 2 of the seats inside the Hitchhiker have signs over them saying "Food" and "Not Food". Obviously I added text and the down-pointing arrows, but I only did so because the words above the seats immediately suggested this to me.

This one made me lough out loud literally :DD

Please use "-snip-" when quoting pictures ^^

Nice station,I wonder,how you built that

JNice station,I wonder,how you built that

Honestly, I didn't launch all the pieces up to build that station; I just savefile-edited it into orbit. I was more interested in getting it in space than getting it there legitimately, as it's a 3D variant on a logo of mine. You can see the 2D version of the logo on my most-used non-default KSP mission flag:
You can always just launch it in one piece.
Easy for you to say.
Well, there was the weird glitch I encountered a while back.

You can always just launch it in one piece.

If I were a maximalist (I'm pretty sure that's not a real word) like you, I'm sure I would. I tend to favor the other direction, trying to keep as much as possible still attached to my ship by the time I get to orbit without leaving useless hardware in orbit in the process.

I've been told that my old Ouroboros station is kind of creepy.

You tell me.

Jinkies! Turns out the space ghost was really old man Kerman who lives at the abandoned space funfair
I wonder how kraken didn't destroy that space station

I find Ike creepy. It's dark for starters, but it also is probably sentient. It purposely interferes with our Duna encounters. [conspiracyalert] But where is the origin of its intelligence? It could be the Magic boulder, but the boulder is absent in this version of the game. It could've crashed into Duna and sunk into its core! Since it is now part of a larger celestial mass, it can use its influence to control Ike further! The white steam may be escaping gasses that the boulder produces as a byproduct and the SSTV hill signal may be where it releases its influence to control Ike's orbit! What if the boulder controls the WHOLE SOLAR SYSTEM!? [/conspiracyalert]

...I really don't know what came over me there...
Duna's SSTV got me off guard.

I went through a phase a while back (like 0.19) where a lot of my craft where a bit creepy.

This one had front mounted grabbing arms;

I'd left it in orbit once and was doing something with a nearby craft when this thing suddenly loomed out of the darkness. Far from getting a scr-shot of that, I nearly leap't out of my chair.

This was one of my other more sinister craft, the Reaver;

Not had anything creepy recently, although...Laythe's oceans kinda creep me out, I don't like swimming in them, too opaque, feels like something is lurking.
